page.title: 04A Dairy Farm in Taddington
page.content: My grandad's dairy farm is at least 500 years old.At one time part of the barn at the side of the house was used as a chapel.It is really three farms in one and covers 150 acres. He has about fifty milking Friesian cows and a lot of growing calves and heifers. The main crop is grass which is cut in summer for silage and three fields of hay for the young calves.Straw is bought as bedding for the winter when the animals are kept inside.In the late Spring,the animals are let out into the fields until the Autumn. The cows are milked twice a day -early morning and evening.My grandad and dad use various tractors for the many different jobs such as cleaning out the buildings,spreading slurry,carting water to the animals in the fields as well as many more besides the busy time of silaging,haymaking and baling.
